note.p: Education: BA (1776), MA (1779) Trinity College, Cambridge
Career: Chaplain of King's College, Cambridge; published Flora Cantabrigiensis (1785); Relhania (compositae) named after him by L'Heritier
References: L B Glyn, 'Israel Lyons: a short but starry career. The life of an eighteenth-century Jewish botanist and astronomer' in NR 2002 vol 56 pp 275-305
